description:
This psychological thriller, based on the manga written and illustrated by Sakae Esuno, is about Yuki, a loner who's not very good with people. He prefers to write a diary on his cell phone and talk to his imaginary friend, Deus Ex Machina – The God of Time and Space. However, Yuki soon learns that Deus is more than a figment of his imagination when he makes Yuki participate in a battle royale with eleven others. The contestants are given special diaries that can predict the future, each diary possessing unique features that give it both advantages and disadvantages. Within the next 90 days, the contestants must try to survive until there is only one left standing. The winner will become the new God of Time and Space.

(Source: FUNimation)

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Netorare
tags.description: Netorare is what happens when the protagonist gets their partner stolen from them by someone else. It is a sexual fetish designed to cause sexual jealousy by way of having the partner indulge in sexual activity with someone other than the protagonist.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Stop Motion
tags.description: Animation style characterized by physical objects being moved incrementally between frames to create the illusion of movement.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/よしもときんじ)

Founder of Earthwork, together with [Satoshi Urushihara](https://anilist.co/staff/98177/) and Yoshihiro Kimura.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Official Website](http://www.topazios.net/) 

Yui Itsuki is a Japanese voice actress who works for Holy Peak. As a musician, she is currently the lead vocalist for the band Yousei Teikoku (under the persona of "Dictator for Life" 終身独裁官, the supreme leader of The Fairy Empire).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/midorihatoneko) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/286739197)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [older animator](https://anilist.co/staff/250761/) by the same name._
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ka2hikoTakayama) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/KatsuhikoTakayama00/)

[Official Website](http://dasfeenreich.com/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6CDPvGtPJ6Iz7uftJYQpxO?autoplay=true) 

Yousei Teikoku is a four-member Japanese musical unit, formed in 1997 and part of TEAM FAIRITHM. Their music contains elements of electro, EBM, darkwave, neoclassical, ethereal and ambient mixed with gothic rock/metal. They have released several independent albums and four major release albums with their current publisher Lantis: Gothic Lolita Propaganda, metanoia, Gothic Lolita Doctrine and Gothic Lolita Agitator.  The members are: 

Itsuki Yui - vocals, chorus, and lyric writing. | Tachibana Takaha - keyboards, guitar, composition, arrangement and lyric writing. Has worked with Kukui in the past. | Nanami - bass guitar. | Relu - drums. 

Prior to the release of Baptize, Yui and Tachibana were the group's only members. Nanami and Relu have since been added. Yousei Teikoku literally means Fairy Empire. Through music, Yousei Teikoku is attempting to revive the Fairy Empire that exists between the human world and the spiritual realm known as Spiritual. The purpose of their music is "to make humans remember the pure heart inside them that believes in fairies, forgotten before we knew it". "Gothic" and "empire" are key words in their musical ideas.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/itsuro_k)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/itsuro_k)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/itsuro_k)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zachbolton6)

Also a line producer.

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/faylan/)

Before she was signed with Lantis, she had released one single under Hobirecords.  
Non-anime singles:  "Gekka no Rasen" - PC game Touka Gettan ED "Never Slash!!" - PC game "Gakuto!" theme song "Reconquista" - PC game "Reconquista" theme song "conspire" - PC game Valkyrie Complex insert song "Soukyuu no Hikari" - BlazBlue Continuum Shift Extend opening song (PS3/360)
Originating from [Sunshine Corporation](https://anilist.co/studio/7108/).

__Graduated:__ Tokyo College of Music

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cut_tatsu7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tatsuya__kato/)
